Text: Galiens li Restorés, or Galien le Restoré or Galien rhétoré (in English, "Galien the Restored"), is an Old French "chanson de geste" which borrows heavily from chivalric romance.

<Text: Galiens li Restorés:  Five versions of the tale are extant, dating from the fifteenth century to the sixteenth century, one in verse and the others in prose.>
Triplets:<Galiens li Restorés
3:
--------------------
Text: Galiens li Restorés:  The story—which is closely linked to the earlier "chansons de geste" "Pèlerinage de Charlemagne" and "The Song of Roland" (especially in the latter's rhymed version)—tells of the adventures of Galien, son of the hero Olivier and of Jacqueline, the daughter of the (fictional) emperor Hugon (Hue the Strong) of Constantinople.
